protocol.text: Arabidopsis thaliana (accession Col-0) and the oas-a1.1 mutant (SALK_072213) seeds were grown on Petri dishes on MS medium containing 2.5 g L-1 Phytagel (Sigma-Aldrich) and 1% (w/v) Suc for two weeks and then seedlings were transferred to hydroponic culture. The nutrient solution contained 2 mM Ca(NO3)2, 0.5 mM KH2PO4, 0.75 mM MgSO4, 10 mM KNO3, 1.5 µM CuSO4, 2 µM ZnSO4, 10 µM MnSO4, 50 µM H3BO3, 0.1 µM MoO3, 50 µM KCl, and 50 µM Fe-Na-EDTA, and was replaced once a week. The Cd treatment of hydroponically-grown plants was performed by adding 50 mM of CdCl2 to the above-described nutrient solution after a two-week period of acclimation to the hydroponic conditions. Plants were grown under a photoperiod of 16 h of white light (120 mE m-2 s-1) at 20ºC / 8 h dark at 18ºC.

Hydroponically-grown plants were cultured in the absence and presence of 50 mM CdCl2 for 18 and 24 h. The untreated-roots, 18 h treated-roots, untreated-shoots and 24h treated-shoots were collected and RNA extracted from each sample. Total RNA was isolated with Trizol reagent (Invitrogen) followed by cleaning with the RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen).
Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 4 µg total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).

Following fragmentation, 15 µg of biotinylated cRNA were hybridized to Affymetrix chips (GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array). Each sample was added to a hybridization solution containing 100mM 2-(N-morpholino)ethanesulfonic acid, 1 M Na+, and 20mM of EDT
GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G
GeneChip intensities were background-corrected, normalized and sumarized by RMA method, using the “Affy” package from Bioconductor.
